bibl.title: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, February 20, 1942

div1.p: Hamer sends Hench copies of documents requested from the National Archives.

div1.head: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, February 20, 1942
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
1934
DIVISION OF REFERENCE
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
February 20, 1942.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This is in reply to your letters of January 31, and
February 6, concerning copies of certain documents which
you personally selected during your recent visit to The
National Archives.

There are transmitted herewith negative photostatic
copies of the documents you selected from the records of the
Bureau of Entomology and Plant Quarantine, Department of
Agriculture, and the Office of the Surgeon General, War Depart-
ment.

We are also sending you under separate cover microcopies
of the documents you selected from the records of the Office
of the Adjutant General and the Office of the Surgeon General,
War Department.

These documents are from the records of the Departments
indicated above, now in The National Archives.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. M. Hamer
Director of Reference Service Enclosures
